snippet: Pete Maro, 46, who had stints in the Devils’ and the Rangers’ systems, is the oldest person — by seven years — to play in the two-year-old Federal Hockey League.
abstract: Profile of Pete Maro, hockey goaltender who had stints in the New Jersey Devils and New York Rangers systems; Maro, who runs an orthodontics practice in Rye, NY, is now goaltender with the Danbury Whalers in the Federal Hockey League; at 46 years old, Maro is the oldest player in the league by seven years.
lead_paragraph: Pete Maro, 46, who had stints in the Devils’ and the Rangers’ systems, is the oldest person — by seven years — to play in the two-year-old Federal Hockey League.

headline.seo: Don’t Tell This Orthodontist He Can’t Play Hockey Forever
headline.main: Don’t Tell This Orthodontist He Can’t Play Forever
headline.print_headline: At 46, an Orthodontist Is Still Stopping Shots
